content: But as you think about 2023 from an operating perspective, we're still seeing -- we are seeing a lag in pricing offsetting inflation, which we do expect to catch up in 2023, have expectations that next year is more in sync with our long-term algorithm of kind of mid-single digits top line growth with some leverage on EBITDA and then I think importantly, from a cash flow perspective, expect significant tailwinds from working capital investments that we've made in 2022, don't see the severity of those carrying forward, actually much less severity as that's already kind of the cost of flowing through to the working capital side as well as just more improved costs overall, as Albert alluded to, streamlining the operating model going forward in North America.
